days.label: Day 1 — Perception Calibration

drills.text: Color breath: pick a hue; inhale the color, exhale its complement. Note the feeling shift.
drills.prompt: Guide me through a 3-minute color-breath practice. I choose [COLOR]. Have me imagine inhaling it and exhaling its complement. Give calm cues every 20–30 seconds.

drills.text: Sound matching: hum while looking at swatches; stop on the hue that fits your tone.
drills.prompt: Coach me to hum a steady tone and scan colors until one matches the feeling. Ask for one word that describes the match.

drills.text: Word association: write 3 words for one chosen color.
drills.prompt: Help me produce three immediate words for my chosen color without overthinking; then compress into one 10–12 word line.

days.checkpoint_prompt: Give me 3 yes/no cues: could I feel a difference between two hues, match one to a tone, and describe it in a word? If any 'no', offer a 60-second remedial scan.

days.label: Day 2 — Translation Practice

drills.text: Color → Note: assign five colors to notes and hum them in order (palette melody).
drills.prompt: Help me map five chosen colors to nearby pitches and hum a simple palette melody. Keep the total under 2 minutes.

drills.text: Word gradient: arrange words from coolest→warmest; sketch a matching color line (mental or paper).
drills.prompt: Ask me for 5 feeling-words; sort them cool→warm and suggest a simple matching gradient description.

drills.text: Movement match: move your hand with each color’s tempo (slow violet → quicker yellow).
drills.prompt: Give a 60-second kinesthetic drill to move hand speed and arc to match each color’s implied tempo.

days.checkpoint_prompt: Quick test: can I reproduce my palette melody by memory and describe its mood in one sentence?

days.label: Day 3 — Integration & Expression

drills.text: Color journal: draw or imagine a gradient and write one short line per band.
drills.prompt: Guide me to create a 3-band gradient and write one short line per band linking color→tone→word.

drills.text: Synesthetic soundtrack: pick a song; note colors it paints start→finish.
drills.prompt: Prompt me to listen to one song and write a 4-part color progression it evokes (intro, verse, chorus, outro).

drills.text: Silent visualization: think a word (hope/storm) and note first flashed color.
drills.prompt: Lead a 60-second quiet visualization with two words (hope, storm) and ask for first color flashes, then one integrating sentence.

days.checkpoint_prompt: Readiness: can I name a color, hum its note, and say one precise word within 10 seconds? If yes, generate a 12-word Jar badge line.

global_prompts.jar_badge: Write a 12-word status for Jar based on my color–sound checkpoint result.
global_prompts.coach_timer: Coach me through [DRILL] for [DURATION] with calm cues every [INTERVAL]. Keep it under 120 words.
